verb.description: To lie or pass across; to move or travel across. Also without object: to intersect.

preposition.description: Across, over; from side to side of. Now archaic and rare.

origin: 1950s; earliest use found in The Sheboygan Press. From over- + either cross or cross<br>late Middle English; earliest use found in Vegetius' De Re Militari. From over- + cross<br>late 15th century; earliest use found in St. Machor. From over + cross.
